ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detector (EPEAD) alpha particle fluxes data at 5 min Time Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) are essentially the same as the Energetic Particle Sensor (EPS) on GOES 8-12. There are two EPEADs on each satellite, one looking east and one looking west. For more information, please see Onsager et al. 1996, Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES 8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA. These data file contain mainly information on the alpha particle fluxes from B detector. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Office of Space Science Applications (United States), NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States), Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 13

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron, and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) Data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g13_epead_a16e_32s_20080301_20080301.csv, indicates GOES 13 magnetometer data at 32 s time resolution from 2008-03-01.

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds. Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags.

NumericalData.Keyword: Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds.

Parameter.Name: Data points per average.
Parameter.Description: Number of data points per average.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for alpha particles with energy 6.9 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of alpha particles with energy 6.9 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 6.9 MeV alpha particles from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite. The B detector faces East when the yaw flip flag is 0 and West when the yaw flip flag is 1.

Parameter.Name: Data points per average.
Parameter.Description: Number of data points per average.

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for alpha particles with energy 6.9 MeV.
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue.

Parameter.Name: Average flux of alpha particles with energy 6.9 MeV
Parameter.Description: Average flux of 6.9 MeV alpha particles from the A detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite. The B detector faces East when the yaw flip flag is 0 and West when the yaw flip flag is 1.
